clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Evaluation of a Self-etch Adhesive Using a Selective Etch Technique
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Evaluation of 3M ESPE Adper Easy Bond Self-Etch Adhesive Using a Selective Etch Technique

brief_summary.textblock: Study hypothesis: Etching the enamel followed by use of a self-etching adhesive on enamel and dentin is as effective as a one-step etch and rinse approach.

detailed_description.textblock: There is scant evidence available on the performance of self-etching dental adhesive systems. This study aims to clinically evaluate a self-etch adhesive used either with an extra enamel etching step, or in a self-etch stand alone technique with no extra enamel etch.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical performance of the study restoration
secondary_outcome.description: Restoration in satisfactory clinical function at one year

intervention.intervention_name: Adper Easy Bond Self-etch dental adhesive
intervention.description: Bonding composite to restore Class I or Class II cavities
intervention.other_name: self etch adhesive with enamel etch

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18 years or older
- written informed consent
- regular dental attender, can return to clinic for study recalls
- good medical health
- normal saliva flow
- has one or two pairs of back teeth that require a Class I or II restoration of appropriate size
- study teeth that are vital
Exclusion Criteria:
- currently in an evaluation of other dental materials
- an irregular dental attender
- has unacceptable oral hygiene standards
- has chronic periodontitis or rampant caries
- has teeth with signs of periapical pathology
- has history of pulp problems, and/or needs pulp treatment
- women who are pregnant or breast-feeding
- has known allergy to resin composite or latex
- has serious chronic disease requiring hospitalization
- has oral soft tissue pathologies
- takes medications which, in the opinion of the investigator, could interfere with the conduct of the study
- has current or recent history of alcohol or other substance abuse
- is an employee of the sponsor or the study site, or members of their immediate family
- has had any restorative treatment of teeth involved in the study in the last twelve months
